data.title: Pittsburgh Post Gazette
data.meta_description: MARY MASTERSON passed away. This is the full obituary where you can share condolences and memories. Published in the Pittsburgh Post Gazette on 2024-04-06.
data.text:
MASTERSON

MARY

Mrs. Mary Masterson, 96, of Pittsburgh, peacefully passed away on Wednesday, April 3, 2024, in Sarasota, Florida.

Mrs. Masterson was born on February 14 (Valentine's Day), 1928, in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania to the late Dimitrios and Angeliki Gianoutsos. She was a 1946 graduate of Fifth Avenue High School in Pittsburgh. She worked for Gianoutsos Brothers Painting, and was known as an extraordinary seamstress and milliner. She was a dedicated wife, and loving mother and grandmother.

She is survived by her son, Peter (Teresa) Masterson of Lakewood Ranch, Florida; daughter-in-law, Carrie Masterson of Greensburg, Pennsylvania; and her grandchildren, Cole (Carmen) Masterson, Bianca Masterson, Marina Masterson, Sophia Masterson, Gina Masterson, Carlie (Giovanni) Monteleone, and Alexis Masterson; as well as many nieces and nephews.

She was preceded in death by her parents; her husband, Nicholas Masterson (August 2, 1928 - October 20, 2018) to whom she was married for 64 years; her son, James Masterson (October 18, 1961 - July 31, 2023); her sister, Panagiota; and brothers, Mike Gianoutsos and Nick Gianoutsos.

Visitation will be held on Thursday, April 11, 2024, from 4-8 p.m. at BEINHAUER FUNERAL HOME, 2630 West Liberty Avenue, Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania 15216 (Dormont). A viewing and funeral service will be held on Friday, April 12, 2024, at 11 a.m. - 12 p.m., service starting at 12 p.m. at Holy Cross Greek Orthodox Church, 123 Gilkeson Rd., Pittsburgh, PA 15228. Entombment will follow at Jefferson Memorial Park Cemetery.

Memorial contributions in Mrs. Masterson's name may be made to the Holy Cross Agape Fund at holycrosspgh.org.

Published on April 6, 2024

Plant a tree: How does it work

When your purchase is complete, a post will be made on the tribute wall of the deceased signifying the planting of a memorial tree.

An official certificate recognizing your purchase will be included with your email receipt. You can then forward the email to the family or print it and give it to them personally.

After an order is placed, our forestry partners will plant the tree in the area of greatest need (nearest the funeral home), according to the planting schedule for the year.

Due to seasonal conditions, the tree planting takes place during the spring and summer.

Tree Planting Timeline

Orders placed in:

January - May

Planting will take place in Spring or Summer of the same year.

June - December

Planting will take place in Spring of the following year.
